utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Morning, roomy!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey! You remembered to put clothes on this morning.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Fifth day's a charm.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, Joey, it's so great to be back here. I gotta tell you, you're making it so easy on me and Emma.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, it's great having you back. You know, stay as long as you want, and when does she stop crying all night?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, you're not naked! So hey, Raych, when will we expect to see you tonight?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, I'll probably be back to pick her up around six, but she's in the bedroom all ready to go. But she did actually fall back to sleep, so...

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: She's probably exhausted from all that adorable screaming she did last night.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Bye!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Bye! Hey, I hope Emma isn't making it too hard on you.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No, hey, it's been great.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah. And look, I just want you to know that with Rachel staying here and everything, all my feelings from before are totally over, okay? And even if they weren't, when you accidentally walk in on a woman using a breast pump...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, that'll do it.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Wow! So, how are you?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I'm, I'm okay.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Sure, I mean, do I wish me and Rachel living together would have worked out? Of course. You know, I'm disappointed, but it's not like it's a divorce.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, actually it...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, it's not a divorce, it is not a divorce! Anyway, I think Rachel and I need to, you know, get on with our lives, maybe, maybe start seeing other people.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Wow, really?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, sure, why not? In fact, if you know anyone that would be good for me...

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Sure, I know lots of girls.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah? Any names come to mind?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ooh, names?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey. I was just gonna get something to eat. You want something?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What you got?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay, let's see, we got strained peas, strained carrots... Ooh! Strained plums. We haven't tried that yet.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Goodie! Thanks. So, how is it living with Rachel again? I mean, apart from the great food.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I'm fine, I'm fine, it's just, it's just weird what's happening with her and Ross. You know, yesterday he asked me to fix him up with somebody.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh my god, Rachel asked me if I knew anyone for her too.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Why are they doing this?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I don't know. They're so perfect for each other; it's crazy.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You know what's crazy? These jars. What is it, like two bites in here?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I just wish they'd realize they should be together.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I know, I know. And when they moved back in together, I figured y'know, that's where things were headed.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I know. They should be a family. They should get married and have more children.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yes, and they should name one of their kids Joey. I may not have kids; someone's gotta carry on the family name.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You know what? Maybe once they start dating, and they see what's out there, they'll realize how good they are for each other.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, because it is slim pickings. I had this date last night: Yuck! But we should probably keep it down; she's still in the bedroom.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: So, what are we gonna do? Are we just gonna go ahead and set them up with people?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I know; that just pushes them further and further apart.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah. ... Oh, I know what we can do. We could set Ross and Rachel up on horrible dates, so that they'll realize how good they are together.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ooh, that's a great plan!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, you know what the best part of it is? I get to do my "plan-laugh."

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Shhh! Not so loud, we don't wanna wake up, uh...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You guys aren't doing anything tonight, are you?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: See, now, why would you assume that? Just because we're married? I will have you know that we are very hip, happening people. Now, if you'll excuse me, I have to get back to reading the obituaries.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I was just asking 'cause I need someone to watch Emma tonight.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Sure, we'll do that. What are you up to?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, Phoebe set me up on a date.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my god.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Why? What's the big deal?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Just figured, 'cause you and Ross are...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What, slept together a year and a half ago? Yeah, I'm all set.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, I think it's great that you're going on a date, you know? I mean, it sounds healthy. I mean, you have needs. Embrace your womanhood!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You want a job? Turn off "Oprah," and send out a resume!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So I'll bring her by around seven? Is that okay?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, it's perfect.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, you guys are gonna have so much fun! She's at such a cute age. Oh, a couple things. Now that she's eating solid food, she poops around the clock. And watch out for your hair, 'cause she likes to grab it. And oh, she's also in this phase where if you leave the room, she screams bloody murder, but ah... Thanks, you guys. Have fun!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Suddenly I wish I was reading my own name.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ooh, Joey.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey. I'm so excited; I just set up Rachel with the worst guy tonight.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right! Who is he?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, it's this guy I used to massage. And by massage, I mean hold down so he wouldn't turn over and flash me.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay, okay. Wait till you hear who I got for Ross.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, yeah.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: She's this really boring woman. She's a teacher!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: A teacher?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, she's really into history and foreign movies... And oh, oh, she loves puzzles. Huh? Come on, who loves puzzles?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, Ross does. What... You're - you're ruining the plan! Joey, you've - you've fixed him up with his perfect woman!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh my god, you're right!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: She even reads for pleasure!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: How do you even know a woman like that?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What? I'm not allowed to know smart women?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Joey.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I met her at the library. I went in to pee.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: So now what do we do?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, okay, I'll - I'll just call her and tell her the date's cancelled, and find him somebody else.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What if we don't find him somebody else? We'll just tell her the date's off, but we don't tell Ross, and he goes to the restaurant and gets stood up!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ooh...I hear that's bad.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ooh, so this is great! Rachel's gonna have a terrible date, Ross gets stood up, and then they'll realize how good they have it together.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ah, yes, The Plan!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: It's not Santa's plan. No, it's...

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, you know, it's not that fun.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, I think we killed it.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Emma? Emma? Look at me! Well, I think I'll go downstairs for a while.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No, no, no, no! No, no, no, no! It's okay, it's okay. I didn't go. Don't cry, it's just a bit! I'm your uncle Chandler; funny is all I have!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, just so you know, I'm gonna be ovulating from tomorrow until the sixth, so don't touch yourself in the next 48 hours.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I don't do that.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I'll try to stop. Wait, did you say until the sixth?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Today is the sixth.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No, it's not.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes, it's also 2003.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my god. Today's the sixth?! I may be done ovulating! I may have also served some very questionable meat at the restaurant.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It's okay. Go take the test and see if we're okay.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Tough crib.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey, where are all my ovulation-sticks? There's only one here.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I might have checked to see if I was ovulating a couple times.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Chandler!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I am not working. There's not much to do around here!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Excuse me, is there a woman waiting at the bar? Someone average height, dark hair, perhaps doing a puzzle?

utterance.speaker: Waiter
utterance.content: Uh, there's a drunk Chinese guy.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, if I'm still here in an hour, buy him a drink on me.

utterance.speaker: Waiter
utterance.content: Can I get you another glass of wine?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Nah, I don't know if I should. I don't wanna be drunk when I go home alone.

utterance.speaker: Waiter
utterance.content: Got stood up, huh?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, it's no big deal. It's just a blind date.

utterance.speaker: Waiter
utterance.content: Are you worried your date came, saw you, and left?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: We're okay. I'm still ovulating.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, good, because as of four o'clock this afternoon, I am not.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So, let's do this.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I - I don't think I can.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Come on. I know you're not eighteen anymore, but give it a minute.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Because of Emma.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my god, Emma. Oh, sweetie, I forgot you were here. Oh, you're right, we can't do this. We can't leave her alone.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Unless... Maybe we do it here. I mean, how much can she even be aware of at this age?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, she's aware when we leave the room. She may notice if we start... canoodling in it.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Canoodling?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, I can't say "hump" or "screw" in front of the B-A-B-Y.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I don't know. I mean, I guess having sex in front of a baby isn't so...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Horrifying? Scarring? Something people go to jail for?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I guess you're right.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You guess I'm right? When we stayed at that bed and breakfast, you wouldn't have sex with me because you thought a deer was staring through the window.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: But what kind of a sick bastard wants to do it in front of a deer?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Wow, everything looks so good! I think I'm gonna have the chicken.

utterance.speaker: Steve
utterance.content: I - I just have to say this; you're really beautiful.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, well, that's - that's very sweet. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Steve
utterance.content: I'm kind of funny looking.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Steve
utterance.content: Oh, come on, you're way out of my league. Everybody in here knows it. Bet that guy over there's probably saying, "ooh, why she out with him? He must be rich!" Well, I'm not!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So, what do think you wanna order? I'm really excited about that chicken.

utterance.speaker: Steve
utterance.content: I'm not funny either. So, if you were thinking, "well, he's not that good-looking, but maybe we'll have some laughs"... That ain't gonna happen.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, come on, Steve; let's not rule out nervous laughter. Hey, now wait a minute. Phoebe told me that - that you owned your own restaurant. That's impressive.

utterance.speaker: Steve
utterance.content: I lost it. To drugs.

utterance.speaker: Steve
utterance.content: I silk-screen t-shirts now.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Really? What's that like?

utterance.speaker: Steve
utterance.content: It's really fulfilling doing something you hate for no money. That's right. I have no money, I'm not funny, I live in a studio apartment with two other guys, and I'm pretty sure I'm infertile.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Now, come on, come on, Steve. There must be something that you like about yourself.

utterance.speaker: Steve
utterance.content: I do like my hair.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Phoebe, it's me. I'm going to hunt you down and kill you!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey, Raych!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: This is the worst date ever. How could you set me up with this creep?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You know, you are talking about one of my dear, dear friends.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I don't care! This guy is a nightmare!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, right, so he gets a little crazy when he's stoned.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: He's not stoned.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Did he go out for a cigarette?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, four times.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: My dear, sweet Raych.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, our plan is working. Rachel is having a miserable time, and Ross is just stood up somewhere at a restaurant all alone.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, great, pretty soon they'll be back together.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: By the time anyone's figured out what we've done, we'll be in sunny Mexico....Oh, wait, that's the end of a different plan.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: She's asleep. Chandler?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Emma was doing it!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: She's asleep.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ooh, she's asleep, that means we can...

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yes, but we have to be fast.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, I'll try. And you can't make any noise.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, I'll try.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Emma? Hey! Hi!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: How are ya? How are ya? Where are your babysitters, huh? Why's the bedroom door closed?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You can't have S-E-X, when you're taking care of the B-A-B-I-E!

utterance.speaker: Waiter
utterance.content: I've got bad news. The Chinese guy left.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Eh, if it was meant to be, it's meant to be.

utterance.speaker: Waiter
utterance.content: Look; you got stood up, who cares? We're gonna show you a good time. Just sit and relax. In fact, let me bring you a crab cake appetizer on the house.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Wow, free crab cakes. Well, that's nice. Although I was hoping to have sex tonight.

utterance.speaker: Waiter
utterance.content: Ooh...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Just the crab cakes.

utterance.speaker: Waiter
utterance.content: Just get out of here, okay?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What's - what's going on?

utterance.speaker: Waiter
utterance.content: Eh, okay, the waiters have a little pool going. We have a bet on how long it'll take before you give up and go home.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What? You - you're making money off my misery?

utterance.speaker: Waiter
utterance.content: Well, if you stay till 9:20, I am.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: This is unbelievable. I - I have never been so insulted in my life. Now, if you'll wrap up my free crab cakes, I'll be on my way.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, that was weird. You were loud, and I was fast.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I think we may have really done it this time.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, I wish I didn't have to wait to take a pregnancy test.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You may wanna get some more of those too.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Where's Emma?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my god, where's Emma? Where's Emma?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Don't ask me, I was in there canoodling you!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, okay, I'm sure that Rachel came home early and picked up Emma. You go look across the hall, and I'll call her cell.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey, you better hope that we're pregnant, because one way or another, we're giving a baby back to Rachel.

utterance.speaker: Steve
utterance.content: I - I can't believe I抦 crying in front of you. You must think I'm so pathetic.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, no, no, I admire a man who can cry.

utterance.speaker: Steve
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Don't touch my coat!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, sorry, it's my phone. Hello?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey, Raych, how's it going?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my god, this is the worst date ever!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Look, you know what, I'm sorry, but did you really think that this was going well? What's up?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey, did you stop by here?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my god, then...

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, thank god! Emma, there you are!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What? What do you mean, "there you are"? Where was she?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, we were playing "peek-a-boo." She just ?she loves it when I'm dramatic.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Why the hell did you take her?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Because you two were having sex!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No, we weren't!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Don't you lie to me! I could tell by Chandler's hair. You are so lazy. Can't you get on top for once?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All right, all right, we were. We were trying to make a baby. Monica's ovulating.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey! It is unacceptable that you two would have sex with Emma in the next room. I'm gonna have to tell Rachel about this.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No, no, no.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No, please don't. Please, Joey. She will kill us!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, I gotta! Unless...

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Unless what?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Unless you name your firstborn child Joey.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What? Why?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, I may never have kids, and somebody's gotta carry on my family name.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Your family name is Tribbiani.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, uh...

utterance.speaker: Steve
utterance.content: Look, I think I know the answer to this question, but... Would you like to make love to me?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Really, really not.

utterance.speaker: Steve
utterance.content: Eh, it's just as well. Doesn't work anyway.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: All right, well that's good to know. Good night, Steve.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, what's wrong?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I just had a rough night.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh. Crab cake?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Eww!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, what happened?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, well, I...It's kind of weird talking to you about this, but...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Monica told me you had a blind date.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I did, too.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: But is it technically a date if the other person doesn't show up?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, oh no. Do you think she walked in, saw you and left?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Why does everyone keep saying that?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, if it makes you feel any better, I wish my date hadn't shown up.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That bad?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, he makes t-shirts for a living, and he thought it would be appropriate to give me this.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Female body inspector? What size is that?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Now, wait a minute. So, they're gonna name their first child Joey?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: How - how do I get them to name the next one after me?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: It's easy, you just walk in on them having sex.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, so they owe me like, three Phoebes.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh my god! Look, it's Ross and Rachel. Oh, the plan is working.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Don't, don't do the plan-laugh.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: The first date we've had in months, and they were both such disasters.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh. Huh. You know, it is weird that Phoebe would set me up on a date that was awful on the same night that Joey set you up on a date that didn't even show.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Wait a minute; you don't think it was intentional? I mean, that's just stupid.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: We're geniuses! Yeah, look at them, look at them, they're really bonding.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, they're falling in love all over again.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, they see us! Oh, they, they look mad. Oh, they figured it out. They're coming this way. Run!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Where?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Mexico!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Can you believe they're still not here?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I know. A double blind date, and we both get stood up. What are the chances?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I know, I'm so bummed. Can we have our free crab cakes now?

utterance.speaker: Waiter
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: We've been stood up. And we want our free crab cakes.

utterance.speaker: Waiter
utterance.content: Guys, give it a rest. Nobody's betting on you tonight. Although we do have a pool going to see how long it takes that guy to cry.

utterance.speaker: Steve
utterance.content: I have such fat hands!
